##### AXESSTMC  | a brand by Zucchetti Axess


Zucchetti Axess is a company specialized in integrated

hardware and software systems for access control of

people, vehicles and goods as well as anti-intrusion and

video surveillance, workplace safety, presence detection

and human resource management.

With over 300 partners and thousands of readers and

terminals sold every year to companies in all sectors,

Zucchetti Axess is an international company present in

50 countries around the world.


Zucchetti Axess has been operating in the access
control sector for over fifteen years, supplying

complete and technologically advanced systems for the
identification of people, goods and vehicles in order to

guarantee safety within the workplace. Scalability and

versatility are the strengths of Zucchetti Axess solutions

which allow you to satisfy even the most complex

security management needs.

##### PURCHASE OR SUBSCRIPTION

Some of the products offered by Zucchetti Axess, can be used in
“ **subscription mode** ” by paying a periodic fee for the time of use.

Subscription mode is an alternative to **purchase** . Products available for
both subscription and purchase are specified in this catalog. All other
items are available for purchase only.

**FEATURES of “SUBSCRIPTION”:**

- Full risk cover for the entire duration of the Subscription
(except vandalism and geopolitical events)

- Swap of the terminal in the event of failure

- Upon purchase, payment of the fee until the end of the year

- Annual fee invoices for each calendar year

- Minimum term 3 years

##### OUR TECHNOLOGIES

### HARDWARE
##### TERMINALS CONTROLLERS READERS TAG


Elegant design and latest technologies make

our products suitable for access control.

time&attendance, production control, canteen

management and many other data collection

applications.

AxessTMC devices can operate both with the

Xatlas system and with third-party software.

They can also operate in stand-alone mode,

thanks to their web interface that allows you

to configure and manage them.


14

##### Ethernet POE Terminals

**FEATURES COMMON TO ALL TERMINALS WITH NATIVE POE:**

**• Ready to use** : Built in Time&Attendance and Access Control

applications. The most used functions are available (time

zones, reasons, alarms, PIN, White list, Black list etc...)

**• Power Over Ethernet** : a single cable (Ethernet) for data and

power supply

**• Full gate management:** gate open, blocked, emergency,

unlocked, left open, gate forced…

**• Optional biometric reader** with enrollment capabilities even

from terminal interface.

**• Password protected USB port** to download users transactions

or to upload a configuration file.

**• Touch screen interface** (except X1 and X2). Capacitive

technology in GLASS versions and resistive in all other devices

**• Battery** for operation even in case of a temporary blackout

**• Integrated** **RFID** **reader** : DESFire, Mifare, NFC,
125Khz, HID PROX, iClass, Legic… (see reader section)
**Bluetooth LE** (optional): to be identified using mobile phone or

BLE TAGS (see BLE reader section)



**• Standard communication protocols** (HTTP, FTP) to facilitate

integration with other software

**• Secure HTTPS protocol** except for X1 and X2

**• FTP Client and FTP server** : transaction can be automatically

transferred to an FTP server at scheduled times (in customizable

format). This allows direct interfacing of the terminal with any

software without the need for software converters or other

communication software (middleware).

**• Expandable** : I/O and readers can be added with RS 485 optional

boads (Field Device). This feature allows a single terminal to

manage more gates. It also allows to install I/O in safe areas

(see Expansion Modules section)

**• Programmable** : with script language (except X1, X2). SuperTRAX

and SuperGLASS also in .NET/Win32

**• Management via WEB browser** : our devices can be configured

and managed via the web (configuration parameters, cards, users

with names, authorizations, clock-in review, gates settings, time

card review, etc.).


15

##### Integrated RFID readers


**RFID readers that can be integrated inside the terminals.**

RF identification is a critical factor in Time&Attendance, Access

Control and data collection systems in general.

All our terminals can manage multiple readers: one internally

integrated with the device and other external readers (TTL and/or

RS485 depending on the model)

This section contains the readers that can be integrated inside the

terminal.

The reader code must be added at the end of the terminal’s part

number to obtain the complete code.



18

.61 / .62 Dual Multitechnology RFID 125KHz(EM4102),14443A, Ultralight, Mifare Classic 1K and 4K, Desfire EV1/2/3 - Dual antenna

.14d Mono Desfire RFID DESFIRE - ISO 14443A/B, ISO 15693, Ultralight, Mifare Classic 1K & 4K, Desfire EV1/2/3, NFC - MONO ANTENNA

.14db Mono Desfire+BLE RFID DESFIRE - ISO 14443A/B, ISO 15693, Ultralight, Mifare Classic 1K & 4K, Desfire EV1/2/3, NFC, BLE - MONO ANTENNA

##### Integrated BLE reader


**Reader with BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) technology - Can be**

**integrated in all POE terminals and controllers**

Terminals and controllers equipped with a reader port can also

internally integrate a reader with BLE technology

BLE technology adds two features to the terminals and controllers

on which it is connected:

- identification using smartphone with the free APP **ENTRO** .

**•** **BLE TAG** can be used to automatically detect people, vehicles
or goods and keep track of their position inside an area (hands

free applications, indoor localization, crowding control...)

This internal BLE reader must be connected to one of the serial

TTL ports of the device. Can be installed also if the terminal has an

internal RFID reder installed.
Reading distance from 30 cm to 10 meters (configurable)

Encrypted data exchange between BLE reader and smartphone/

BLE TAG

relays and inputs (the number of which

varies depending on the model) which

or a siren.

create custom transactions with multiple

data requests (except X1, X2, X2BIO, XA4

and XA4K)

**Biometric reader**

XFamily terminals support biometric

readers. Administrators have the ability to
enroll new finger templates directly from

terminal interface.

authorization groups without performance

degradation. (Do not exceed 2.500 users/

cards and 2.000 authorization groups with

all the features of the POE terminals and

have the CLOKI software pre-installed.

and membrane keyboard

and membrane keyboard

independent gates (maximum 8 doors or 4

the gates managed, The terminal can enroll

available for all models..

Access control and presence detection

functions already integrated.

**READERS**

In addition to the readers that can

be integrated into the terminals (see

sections Integrated RFID readers
and Integrated BLE reader), we offer

a wide range of additional readers

that can be connected to the

terminals and controllers.

**Connection** : readers usually offer

multiple standards for connecting to

the controller (varies by model). TTL

connections for connections of a

few cm, or RS232 serial connections

capable of covering a few meters.

Up to the RS485 standard which

allows the reader to be installed

even hundreds of meters from

the terminal/controller. Readers


equipped with RS485 connection

standards are indicated by the term

FD in the product name.

Readers with USB connection are

also available for connection to a PC

**Interface standards** : our readers
can offer multiple interface

standards (varies with the

model) selectable from the main

Clock&Data (C&D), Wiegand, Serial,

barcode formats. In the RS485

connection, the proprietary SPP and

NET92 protocols are used

:
**Identification technologies**
biometric technologies: facial
and fingerprint recognition. RF
identification technologies start


from the widely used 125 KHz and

cover all the main standards: Mifare,
Desfire, iClass, HID, Legic etc...

Magnetic badge, barcode, QR code

and body temperature readers are

also available.
BLE technology allows identfication

using personal mobile phone.

**Format** : our readers can be add
on modules to be installed above

or below the terminal (XFace

M, QRBOX, Mito-03 and swipe

readers), or devices that can be

installed independently (for example

on the other side of the gate).

##### READERS | XFace M

***XFace M added on top of X3***

**HARDWARE |** READERS | XFACE M


ADD-ON READER FOR FACIAL RECOGNITION with BUILT-IN

THERMOSCANNER - IP55:

**XAtlas or Terminals:** XFace M is designed to be an ADD ON of the X family terminals.

It can also work in XAtlas systems (version 24 or higher) with POE Ethernet connection.

**Up to 10.000 face templates in its built in memory:** Recognition occurs inside the reader.
No data is transmitted externally. Only the user-id corresponding to the identified face is
transmitted to the terminal/controller in RS485 with SPP protocol (as happens with any reader).

Also available versions with 25K and 100K faces templates capacity

**Reflective surface** to facilitate face positioning (no display)

**Speaker for acoustic signals and RGB LED bars for access results** driven by the

master: even if the face is recognized by XFace M, but does not meet access criterias

based on the master’s controls, the LEDs are lit red

**Fake-proof algorithm** distinguishes real faces from photographs **.**

**Different face enrollment methods:**

   - Uploading photos via secure FTP

   - Via WEB by connecting with a browser to the reader’s IP

   - By acquiring the photos via XAtlas which then distributes them to readers

**• Ethernet 10/100 POE**, 2 Mpx camera, thermoscanner for temperature detection,

integrated IR illuminator, IP55 protection

##### ACCESSORIES | MESH BOX

RS485 WIRELESS ROUTER and REPEATER - ALL THE ADVANTAGES

OF RS485 NETWORKS, WITHOUT CABLE

**Allows wireless connection of expansion modules** (readers and I/O) to the RS485 SPP
master device (XIO, AXGATE, X3, SG4, FM….)

**2 operating modes:** SPP Master (manages up to 16 FD devices connected to its RS485
port) or SPP Slave (the one connected to the master device)

**Up to 20 meters indoor.** Longer distance can be covered by adding devices. Each
device automatically repeats the signal of other routers.

**Also available with integrated BLE reader, with or without relays, to fully manage**
**a gate with just a single wireless box:** a BLE Mesh Box is a BLE reader that connects
wirelessly to the master controller/terminal. With a RIO Mesh Box (BLE reader and I/O) you
can completely manage a gate via a remote controller/terminal without the need to lay a
cable.

**A minimum network requires 2 MESH modules:** one for managing FD slave and a
second module connected to SPP Master

##### Xatlas versions comparison

It is important to choose carefully the right version of XAtlas according to your needs. On this page we summarize the main limitations of the

individual versions, particularly the **C-Xatlas** version. It is always possible to upgrade to a higher version.

**The basic version, C-Xatlas**, is particularly suitable for monitoring operation and collecting data from a fleet of devices and then sending it
to time and attendance software. It also offers some access control functionality for simple plants. Among the various limitations detailed in

the table on the next page, we highlight in particular that **C-Xatlas** does not allow plant control on interactive synoptic, nor integration with

video surveillance.

**Multi-gate terminals** : most Axess TMC terminals and controllers can control multiple gates (X3 for example manages up to 8). To accomplish

this, the equipment of readers and I/O is expanded through FD devices connected on the RS485 port. Each reader, input or output is
assigned to a specific gateway. This functionality is fully exploited by **D-Xatlas** and **E-Xatlas**, whereas these terminals, when managed by

**C-Xatlas**, are limited to manage only one gate. Therefore, **C-Xatlas** requires a terminal or controller for each gate even though the terminals

or controllers would potentially be able to control more than one.

The **D-Xatlas** and **E-Xatlas** versions can replicate their databases on FMs and XPoints ensuring the operation of the system or part of it

even in the event of central server failure (Server independent). FMs and XPoints are also required in the case of plants spanning multiple

time zones. Installations managed by **C-Xatlas** must all be within the same time zone.

For particularly critical installations, the **E-Xatlas** version also has the ability to work with multiple databases with load balancing capabilities

to handle even very high demand loads without performance degradation.


134

##### XAtlas Hardware

A wide range of hardware devices are available to allow XAtlas to meet any

control or security need. They are divided into 3 categories:

**•** **FIELD PROCESSOR** : (Only for D-XAtlas and E-XAtlas) they contain
a replica of the database and are able to function even if the server is

unreachable. The 485 Field Devices (FD) connect to these devices. They

can be in DIN rail format (FM) or in terminal format with touch screen

display (XPoint) through which supervisors can access the system or can
function as identification terminals.

**•** **FIELD DEVICE (FD):** RS485 devices that control the physical elements
of the system such as gates or alarms, or allow the user to identify

themselves. They are connected to FIELD PROCESSORS

**•** **ETHERNET FIELD DEVICE (FE):** Same as FDs but the connection to their

controller is via Ethernet connection

In addition to these, almost all the terminals and controllers present in the
Hardware section can also be managed by XAtlas to offer further functions in
the field.

##### Dimensioning Ethernet devices in the XAtlas system

As explained in detail in the section ‘Comparison of XAtlas Versions’, multigateterminals support only 1 slave gate/terminal when

managed by the Xatlas-C version. Below are the values that can be used with Xatlas-D and Xatlas-E editions:

**•** **X7, X4 GLASS, X4, XA4, XA4K X3, X3BIO** : multigate supports up to 8 gates and 8 slave devices

**•** **XIO, i-door e i-door+** : manage up to 8 gates and 24 slave devices

The Field Manager (FM) page as well as the next page, shows the maximum number of terminals X* managed according to FM types (64

in the case of FMV)

**Maximum size of users/cards tables:** in addition to respecting the maximum number of terminals X* per type of Field Manager, must

be respected the recommended maximum size limit of the tables USERS.TXT and CARDS.TXT tables for X* terminal type. Exceeding the

recommended size, the plant may break down, for example concurrently with the resending of all the tables to all the terminals, e.g. after
an Xatlas update or with a high number of daily modifications of the tables.

In Xatlas, in the “Advanced Configuration” panel of each X* terminal it is necessary to enable massive transmission, indexing and (where

possible) the tables compression.

**ATTENTION: Please note that USERS.TXT and CARDS.TXT tables of the X* terminals, contain the data of ALL users of the site to**

**which they belong. Only biometric data are partitioned by authorisation.**

##### XATLAS HARDWARE | FD-WA04

RS485 FIELD DEVICE - MODULE to interface third party devices to D-XATLAS and E-XATLAS

**1 reader port:** The reader port can be configured in many modes to allow interfacing with
the most varied devices: serial (RS232 or TTL), Ck&Data or Wiegand. FD-WA04 does not
have any relay or input.

**2 RS485 ports** : in addition to the RS485 port, featured by all FD devices, to connect to the
master (Field Processor), another RS485 port is available to interface a third-party device.

**RS485 (FD-BUS) connection:** FD WB02 must be connected to a Field Processor (FM or
XPOINT) via RS485 connection. Power also comes from the FD-BUS. It does not have a
battery.
